content: extra fine merino in shade 15-light sea green the scarf measurements given above can be worked with the following yardage requirements 280 m / 305 yards if using either of the recommended yarns 3 balls are required to make a scarf this pattern is for personal use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way © agnes kroner 2025 aurelis scarf by aggie in stitches page 3 / 9 gauge 20 stitches and 32 row = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4 x 4 on 4 5 mm / us 7 needles in textured stitch pattern worked flat after blocking because the stitch pattern includes elongated stitches row gauge does not correspond to an exact number of full pattern repeats and is measured over several repeats and averaged needles 4 5 mm / us 7 needles of your preferred needle type notions tapestry needle measuring tape abbreviations bobble bind off co cast on decrease d decreased increase d increased k knit k2tog knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch decreased m1l make one left-leaning increase using the left-hand needle pick up the bar between the needles from front to back knit it through the back loop 1 stitch increased m1lp make one left-leaning purl increase using the left-hand needle pick up the bar between the needles from front to back purl it through the back loop 1 stitch increased m1r make one right-leaning increase using the left-hand needle pick up the bar between the needles from back to front knit it through the front loop 1 stitch increased m1rp make one right-leaning purl increase using the left-hand needle pick up the bar between the needles from back to front purl it through the front loop 1 stitch increased p purl p2tog purl 2 stitches together 1 stitch decreased rn right-hand needle rs right side sl slip ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches individually knitwise move these 2 stitches back to the left-hand needle and knit them together through the back loops 1 stitch decreased st s stitch es tbl through back loop ws wrong side wyib with yarn held in back wyif with yarn held in front yo yarn over *-* repeat instructions from * to * this pattern is for personal use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way © agnes kroner 2025 aurelis scarf by aggie in stitches page 4 / 9 textured stitch pattern the stitch pattern below is provided for reference only and is not worked separately it is incorporated into the pattern instructions elsewhere the pattern repeat is worked over 3 sts for 6 row the stitch count of one pattern repeat is temporarily increase d to 4 sts in row 3 and it is decrease d back to 3 sts in row 5 the temporarily increase d st will not be mentioned in the instructions as an increase d st row 1 rs p1 k2 row 2 ws p2 k1 row 3
